details.description:
The Jordan 4 Retro White Cement (2025) is a certified legend reintroduced for a new generation. Revered since its 1989 debut, this Tinker Hatfield-designed icon is returning in its most accurate form yet. Expect a crisp summit white leather base with signature cement grey speckles on the midsole and wings, black accents on the mesh and heel, and hits of fire red that keep it rooted in Air Jordan DNA.

What sets the 2025 edition apart is the focus on shape and precision. Jordan Brand took the time to recreate the OG ‘89 cut, giving fans that perfect toe box, padded collar, and clean lines reminiscent of its original glory. Whether you’re a longtime collector or first-time buyer, this drop is poised to be a cornerstone of any sneaker rotation and yes, the Nike Air branding on the heel is back in full force.

The Jordan 4 Retro White Cement (2025) released on May 24, 2025, for a retail price of $225. With its summit white, fire red, tech grey, and black colorway, this drop cements its place as one of the year’s most iconic retros.

The Jordan 4 Retro Fear (2024) marks the return of one of the most anticipated releases from the Fear Pack. Originally released in 2013, the Fear Pack was designed to explore Michael Jordan’s fear of failure and his drive to overcome it. The Jordan 4 Fear stood out from the pack with its sleek black, anthracite, and pure platinum color scheme, giving the iconic silhouette a bold, edgy look. The signature flight patch on the tongue, a hallmark of the Jordan 4, emphasizes the model’s connection to MJ’s legacy and impact both on and off the court.

Crafted with a mix of premium leather and nubuck, the Jordan 4 Fear offers a perfect blend of durability and style. Its visible Air cushioning unit provides superior comfort, while the supportive design ensures the sneaker’s performance capabilities match its striking appearance. The muted black and grey tones are contrasted with white accents, making this one of the most versatile and stylish sneakers in the Jordan lineup. The Jordan 4 continues to rise in popularity, cementing its place as a fan favorite among sneakerheads.

Released on November 9, 2024, the Jordan 4 Retro Fear retailed for $215. With its timeless design and connection to Jordan’s storied legacy, this sneaker is a must-have for collectors and fashion enthusiasts alike, making it one of the most sought-after releases of the year.

The Jordan 4 Retro SB Navy blends basketball heritage with skateboarding functionality, continuing the successful partnership between Nike SB and Jordan Brand. Following the hype of the "Pine Green" release, this edition swaps green for navy, adding a sleek and timeless twist to the SB-enhanced Air Jordan 4 silhouette. The upper features summit white leather with navy accents on the eyelets, heel tab, and midsole, delivering a clean yet bold aesthetic. A vibrant red Jumpman logo on the tongue and insoles provides a striking contrast, while the Nike SB branding on the heel cements this crossover’s skate-ready DNA.

Designed with performance in mind, the Jordan 4 Retro SB Navy incorporates subtle modifications tailored for skateboarding. The reworked sole offers enhanced grip and flexibility, while premium materials ensure durability whether you’re on the board or the streets. The signature mesh side panels and classic lace cage maintain the AJ4’s iconic look, seamlessly merging style and function. The gum yellow outsole adds a vintage-inspired touch while improving traction—essential for both skaters and sneakerheads alike.

Landing on March 18, 2025, for a retail price of $225, the Jordan 4 Retro SB Navy marks the next evolution of this crossover collaboration. With its blend of skate and basketball culture, this release is set to make waves among collectors and casual wearers alike.

The Air Jordan 4 Retro Forget Me Not (Women's) brings a fresh floral vibe to the iconic silhouette. Dressed in a clean white base, the sneaker features accents of aluminum, blue tint, and oil green, creating a serene and stylish look. Removable floral patches on the tongues pay homage to the forget-me-not flower, adding a unique touch that celebrates Mother's Day.​

This women's-exclusive release continues Jordan Brand's commitment to crafting meaningful sneakers. The combination of soft hues and floral details makes it a standout piece for both collectors and those new to the sneaker scene. The design balances elegance and streetwear appeal, making it versatile for various styles.​

Released on May 3, 2025, at a retail price of $215, the Air Jordan 4 Retro Forget Me Not offers a blend of classic design and thoughtful details. Its colorway of white, aluminum, blue tint, and oil green ensures it stands out in any sneaker rotation.​

The Air Jordan 4 Retro Military Blue 2024 stands as a beacon of Jordan Brand's innovation and style. It features an off-white leather base contrasted with the striking military blue splashed on the eyelet wings, heel, and parts of the midsole, creating a look of disciplined yet daring design. The neutral grey touches on the forefoot and outsole balance the aesthetic, highlighting the sneaker's clean lines and geometric shapes.

Every detail is meticulously crafted, with the Jumpman logo on the tongue, the 'Flight' script on the tongue's underside, and a visible Air-Sole unit encased in the sole—all of which are hallmarks of the Jordan brand's dedication to quality and performance. The industrial blue mesh inserts not only offer breathability but also complement the sneaker's color scheme, adding both function and flair. The beloved Nike Air logo graces the heel and stays true to the original 1989 iteration.

Released on May 4, 2024, at a retail price of $215, the Air Jordan 4 Retro Military Blue quickly ascended to iconic status. Collectors and sneaker enthusiasts eagerly celebrated the revival of the military blue colorway on a timeless model.

The Air Jordan 4 Retro White Thunder (GS) is a striking new release that pays homage to one of the most iconic colorways in Jordan Brand history. Inspired by the original Black and Yellow Thunder 4s, this grade school version brings a fresh take to the classic design. The upper features a predominantly black nubuck material, providing a sleek and bold look, while white accents create a sharp contrast. The Jumpman logo appears on both the tongue’s flight patch and the heel, ensuring that this sneaker remains true to its roots while introducing a new visual twist.

The Air Jordan 4 holds a special place in the world of basketball sneakers, originally released in 1989 as the first Jordan model to be released globally. Its unique design elements, such as the plastic wings and mesh netting, set it apart from its predecessors and have made it a fan favorite over the years. The White Thunder colorway continues this legacy by offering a fresh take on the silhouette that captures the essence of the original while adding a modern touch.​

​Released on August 24, 2024, the Air Jordan 4 Retro White Thunder (GS) retailed at $160. The black and white colorway provides a striking contrast that makes this sneaker stand out in any collection. This grade school release ensures that even younger fans of the Jordan brand can step out in style with a piece of basketball history.

The Jordan 4 Retro Seafoam Sail (Women's) is a high-top silhouette in women’s sizing presenting in a calming, seafoam sail colorway.

This high-top Jordan 4 is a retro model and women’s sized sneaker. Dressed in a seafoam, minty green tone, this shoe has a luxurious and elegant aesthetic. The premium nubuck upper adds a velvety touch and while the signature mesh side panels provide breathability. You’ll spot metallic silver detailing in the form of an element that doubles as part of the eye stay. The Jumpman logo is on a patch on the tongue, while the back heel sports the rubberized logo along with the textured pull tab.

StockX experts appreciate the sail-toned midsole that houses the Air unit, while the herringbone-patterned outsole is sail and seafoam with branding underneath. When the Jordan 4 Retro Seafoam Sail (Women's) debuted to the public on March 8, 2025, it sold for $215 retail.

Rediscover a classic with the Jordan 4 Retro Bred Reimagined, dropping on February 17, 2024. This sneaker is a fresh take on the iconic Jordan 4, bringing a contemporary edge to a timeless design. This new release ditches the traditional nubuck, and incorporates a fresh take on the upper with a supple black leather.The Reimagined series, known for breathing new life into classic Air Jordans with innovative materials, makes this release a true collector's item.

The colorway in Black/Cement Grey/Varsity Red/Summit White perfectly balances boldness and tradition. This reinvention of the legendary "Bred" aesthetic combines the familiar with the unexpected, creating a sneaker that's both nostalgic and forward-looking. It's a must-have for both long-time Jordan fans and newcomers to the sneaker scene.

Priced at $210, the Jordan 4 Retro Bred Reimagined is set to be a versatile addition to any collection. Whether you're hitting the streets or just showcasing your style, this sneaker blends history, innovation, and style in a way only Jordan Brand can. Don't miss out on this blend of past and future – grab your pair and step into a new era of sneaker culture.

name: Air Jordan 4 Retro OG SP Nigel Sylvester Brick by Brick

details.description:
The Air Jordan 4 Retro OG SP Nigel Sylvester Brick by Brick is a tribute to NYC's red-bricked streets, where Nigel Sylvester honed his BMX skills. As a long-time Jordan Brand collaborator, Sylvester fuses his love for biking with sneaker culture, crafting a bold design that reflects his journey. The firewood orange suede upper and sail midsole deliver a striking contrast, while the Bike Air branding on the heel adds a unique twist to the traditional Nike Air logo.

Details like the mini embroidered Swoosh on the forefoot, reflective 3M accents, and a worn-in aesthetic set this collaboration apart. The rugged build ensures durability for both BMX riders and streetwear enthusiasts alike. Sylvester's storytelling approach extends to the special packaging, reinforcing the "Brick by Brick" theme that symbolizes his rise.

Released on March 14, 2025, for a retail price of $225, the Air Jordan 4 Retro OG SP Nigel Sylvester Brick by Brick continues Sylvester's legacy of merging BMX culture with high-profile sneaker collaborations. Whether you're riding or collecting, this drop is built to turn heads.

name: Jordan 4 Retro SE Paris Olympics Wet Cement

details.description:
Celebrate classic style as sports enter the world stage with the Jordan 4 Retro SE Paris Olympics Wet Cement. This clean AJ4 delivers in the clutch, with a soft suede and smooth leather finish. The all-gray pair is fit for any occasion with its versatile monochromatic look.

Originally debuting in 1989, the Jordan 4 has become a favorite among sneakerheads, with new and retro styles alike often selling out quickly at retailers. This particular AJ4 draws inspiration from the cobblestone streets of Paris, and is sure to remind seasoned sneakerheads of the grail-like AJ4 KAWS, which was released in 2017.

The Jordan 4 Retro SE Paris Olympics Wet Cement released on July 27th, 2024, for a retail price of $225. Lock in one of the cleanest AJ4s ever today on StockX.

Step into a piece of basketball history with the Air Jordan 4 Retro Bred Reimagined GS. This sneaker revisits the legendary Bred colorway, blending black, cement grey, varsity red, and summit white to create a look that's both classic and fresh. The "Bred Reimagined" offers a new take on a beloved silhouette, honoring the legacy of the renowned shoe while updating the classic nubuck upper with a new supple leather upper.

The Air Jordan 4 Retro is known for its groundbreaking design and performance features, and the Bred Reimagined GS is no exception. Its durable construction and supportive fit make it ideal for everyday wear. The sneaker's iconic colorway and design elements preserve the essence of the original while offering a fresh twist with new materials.

Having made its debut on February 17, 2024, with a retail price of $160, the Air Jordan 4 Retro Bred Reimagined GS has been warmly received by Jordan enthusiasts and sneaker collectors. Its release has reaffirmed the enduring popularity of the Jordan brand and its ability to inspire both nostalgia and innovation. For those seeking to own a piece of sneaker history with a modern twist, the Air Jordan 4 Retro Bred Reimagined GS is an essential addition to your collection.

The Jordan 4 Retro Fear (2024) (GS) relaunches the recognizable silhouette from 2013, this time in a grade school size. It boasts a grayscale colorway with white, black, Anthracite, and Pure Platinum hues.

The sneaker is part of Jordan Brand’s Fear Pack, which promotes fearlessness and overcoming obstacles. The upper is crafted from open-weave mesh in black with layered nubuck overlays in Anthracite and light gray. Signature Air Jordan 4 elements include the nubuck lace cage, TPU eyelets, and visible Air-Sole units in the heel. The 2024 grade-school Jordan 4 Retro Fear showcases a speckled pattern across the midsole that complements the gray tones. The branding details are oversized, including a white Jumpman logo on the heel and a premium tongue tag with Michael Jordan’s signature.

Our experts at StockX like the subtle pop of color provided by the red hue on the Air-Sole units. The grade school-sized Jordan 4 Retro Fear (2024) (GS) was released on November 16, 2024, and sold for $160.

Unveiled on September 9, 2023, the Jordan 4 Retro Red Cement sees a unique twist on a classic colorway with touches of fire red added throughout the silhouette. Jordan Brand didn't hold back on this release, delivering a bold statement piece for those unafraid to stand out.

Constructed with white premium leather uppers, a mix of fire red and black is applied throughout, while the iconic mesh detailing and Jumpman logo retain their traditional placements. Sat atop a black, white, and fire red midsole, the style stays true to its roots, showcasing why the Jordan 4 model remains one of the most iconic Jordan models of all time.

The Jordan 4 Retro Red Cement released on September 9, 2023, with a retail tag of $210, adding another statement piece to the iconic Jordan legacy.

Introducing the Air Jordan 4 Retro Vivid Sulfur Women's, a fresh take on the timeless silhouette that has defined sneaker culture. This new colorway, with its crisp white and coconut milk base accented by vivid sulfur and anthracite, exudes a bold yet refined aesthetic. Tailored for the fashion-forward woman, this sneaker blends the storied heritage of the Jordan 4 with a palette that captures the contemporary vibe, making it a perfect fit for the style-savvy.

The Jordan 4 is renowned for its striking design and the Vivid Sulfur iteration is no exception. From the distinctive mesh on the quarter panels to the unique wings and the innovative support lacing system, every element honors the Jordan 4's rich history. The sulfur color pops on the lace crowns and midsole, giving it a dynamic contrast that's sure to turn heads. The white upper, matched with the coconut milk and anthracite accents, offers a modern twist on the classic, making it a versatile addition to any collection.

Released on April 6, 2024, with a retail price of $210, the Jordan 4 Retro Vivid Sulfur Women's is destined to become a coveted piece in sneaker collections across the globe. Its launch is not about offering a fresh, fashion-forward choice for women who demand both style and substance in their footwear. Grab these exclusive kicks and step into a world where heritage meets modern flair, all wrapped up in the iconic Jordan 4 design.

name: Jordan 4 Retro SP A Ma Maniére Violet Ore

details.description:
James Whitner’s A Ma Maniére and Jordan Brand partner up for this luxury AJ 4 silhouette. The new Air Jordan 4 A Ma Maniére features a deeply rich Violet Ore and vintage cream tones. Sleek metallic pins, tonal mesh detailing and a quilted interior add luxe detailing throughout the silhouette.

The Air Jordan 4 A Ma Maniére released in November of 2022 and retailed for $225.

For the first time in over a decade, the Air Jordan 4 Retro Thunder is returning and is being featured as part of the Jordan Brand Spring/Summer 2023 campaign.

Jordan Brand brought back this fan favorite colorway that is constructed using premium black nubuck uppers with splashes of Tour Yellow throughout the midsole, lace eyelets, and tongue. Michael Jordan's iconic Jumpman logo is placed on the heel tab, tongue and insoles of the sneakers.

The Air Jordan 4 Retro Thunder (2023) released May 13, 2023, with a retail price of $210.

The Jordan 4 Retro White Thunder (PS) adds a monochromatic colorway of black and white to the beloved Jordan Brand silhouette from 1989.

The black upper is crafted from mesh and nubuck, which gives the White Thunder (PS) Jordan 4 Retro sneaker a premium, velvety feel. Additional black details can be found on part of the midsole, the long tongue, and the plastic wings. Pops of white decorate the midsole, the TPU eyelets, and the Jumpman logo. The signature molded mesh on the side panels stands out because it has a looser weave than the mesh used on many Air Jordan 4 models. Another notable feature is the foam midsole that cushions against impact.

Our experts at StockX like the oversized, white Jumpman logo on the heel, which is a nod to Michael Jordan’s gravity-defying athletic skills. The preschool-sized Jordan 4 Retro White Thunder (PS) was released on August 24, 2024, and sold for $100.

The Jordan 4 Retro Metallic Gold (Women's) paints the Air Jordan 4 Retro in off-white Sail and upgrades the recognizable silhouette with gold accents.

The Sail upper, outsole, and midsole provide a monochromatic base that allows the metallic gold eyelets to shine. The AJ 4 features a total of four metallic gold eyelets – two on each side of the lace cage. While the upper is primarily composed of smooth leather, the quarter panel displays mesh that provides an airy feel. The midsole houses a visible Air unit in the heel, which adds responsive cushioning without weighing down the shoe. In terms of branding, the Jumpman logo can be found on the tongue and heel counter in Sail.

Our StockX experts appreciate the addition of a gold Jumpman logo underfoot. It creates a surprise pop of color without a metallic sheen. The women’s size Jordan 4 Retro Metallic Gold (Women's) was released on March 9th, 2024, and retailed at $200.

name: Jordan 4 Retro SE Craft Medium Olive

details.description:
The Jordan 4 Retro SE Craft Medium Olive updates a classic from 1989 and dresses it in subtle tones and complementary textures to create an earthy shoe with bounce and high performance capabilities.

The medium olive colorway of the Jordan 4 SE Retro "Craft" features an upper with an olive green nubuck base, both overlaid and underlaid with soft green suede. The green suede on the side panel is imprinted with a grid pattern, inspired by mesh side panels on previous iterations of the silhouette. Black accents pepper the shoe on the molded eyestays, side panel wings, synthetic heel counter, synthetic mudguard overlay, the sock liner. A vanilla colored Jumpman logo graces both the woven tongue tag and the heel to round out the look of this upper.

What we enjoy most about this sport shoe is the high-octane sole unit. A white lightweight polyurethane foam midsole houses a visible Air unit. The rubber outsole in gray, white, black, and vanilla sports traction as well as a Jumpman logo. The Jordan 4 Retro SE Craft Medium Olive was released on November 18, 2023, for retail price of $210.
